allow: Bash("C:\Program Files\Android\Android Studio\jbr\bin\keytool.exe" -genkeypair -v -storetype PKCS12 -keystore "D:\GymApp\android\app\release.keystore" -alias cleanreps -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 9125 -storepass CleanReps2025Secure -keypass CleanReps2025Secure -dname "CN=Clean Reps, OU=Mobile, O=CleanReps, L=City, ST=State, C=US")
Bash(cmd /c "cd /d d:\GymApp && npx expo prebuild --platform android --clean")

Bash("C:\Program Files\Android\Android Studio\jbr\bin\keytool.exe" -genkeypair -v -storetype PKCS12 -keystore "D:\GymApp\android\app\release.keystore" -alias cleanreps -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 9125 -storepass CleanReps2025Key -keypass CleanReps2025Key -dname "CN=Clean Reps, OU=Mobile, O=CleanReps, L=City, ST=State, C=AU")
Bash(cmd /c "set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Android\Android Studio\jbr && cd /d D:\GymApp\android && gradlew.bat bundleRelease")
Bash(cmd /c "cd /d D:\\GymApp && npx expo prebuild --platform android")

Bash(gh issue create --title "Bug: Layout shifts when inputting data" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Description
UI elements rearrange unexpectedly when inputting data during a workout.

## Current Behavior
When the keyboard appears or while typing, other UI elements shift/move unexpectedly, causing a jarring user experience.

## Expected Behavior
UI should remain stable when keyboard appears. Only the focused input should scroll into view smoothly.

## Screenshot
See: `testing/bug-fix-images/Screenshot_20260113_083632_Clean Reps.jpg`

## Labels
bug, ui
EOF
\)" --label "bug")

Bash(gh issue create --title "Feature: Remember per-exercise history from last session" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Description
The app should remember what weight/reps the user did for each specific exercise in their previous workout session.

## Current Behavior
Currently remembers the last exercise''s input and applies it to the next exercise \(or doesn''t show previous session data\).

## Expected Behavior
When starting an exercise, show the weight and reps from the LAST TIME the user performed that specific exercise. This helps users track progressive overload.

## Example
- User did Bench Press at 55kg x 6 reps last Tuesday
- When they start Bench Press today, it should show/suggest 55kg x 6 as the starting point

## Labels
enhancement
EOF
\)" --label "enhancement")
